Transcript: Eve: Michael -- Michael, don't do this.
Livvie: No, Caleb, stop.
Eve: Let him go, Michael.
Livvie: Listen to me, Caleb.
Caleb: Limb from limb, Olivia. I'll tear him apart.
Eve: Michael, please --
Caleb: And everyone else, all the others.
Livvie: No, you won't. I'll go with you, Caleb.
Alison: Livvie, no!
Caleb: Well, well, well. The gang's all here. Perfect.
Kevin: It's over, Caleb.
Caleb: Oh, no, Dad. It's just beginning.
Eve: Michael, don't do this. Don't let this happen.
Caleb: Michael's not here anymore!
Livvie: I'll be yours, Caleb.
Kevin: No, Livvie.
Eve: Michael, please. This is your life.
Caleb: Shut up!
Eve: This is your soul!
Caleb: Shut up or he dies!
Livvie: No, no, Jack! Please, stop!

Caleb: Oh, you can't protect her now, Dad. You can't protect her now. It's 
too late for all of you!
Kevin: Livvie, let Eve get to Michael. She's the only one who can.
Livvie: No! Caleb, stop!
Kevin: Listen to me. It's Jack's only chance.

Eve: He won't let this happen. He won't let you hurt anyone else -- not 
again. Not Jack, not anyone.
Caleb: Watch me!
Eve: Fight him, Michael. Fight him. I know you can hear me.

Caleb: Infants can survive outside their mothers at 7 1/2 months, Eve. Maybe 
I should end this right now.
Eve: Come to me, Michael. I need you.
Caleb: Reach in and take what I want.
Ian: I can't let this go on much longer.
Lucy: You have to. Just let Eve bring Michael out, and I'll shoot.
Eve: Remember, we met by the monastery --
Caleb: The monastery you burned to the ground?
Eve: That was Caleb's doing. Caleb destroyed it.

Caleb: Think about it, Eve. A child with eyes as red as flame and teeth as 
sharp as razors.
Eve: The monastery was --
Ian: It's not working.

Lucy: No. No, listen. Listen to his voice. I think it might be. It sounds 
like it's changing some.
Michael: Eve.
Eve: Michael. Michael -- that's it, Michael. Open your hands. Let him go.
Caleb: No. No, I don't want to hear any more about Saint Michael.

Eve: I believe in you, Michael. I know you're not a saint, but you're still 
my friend.
Caleb: No!
Eve: And I know your soul weeps when Caleb destroys.
Caleb: Shut up! Shut up!
Eve: Your heart is pure. Your soul is your own.
Caleb: No.
Eve: Come to me, Michael. Come to me.
Michael: I'm here, Eve.
Eve: Michael. I knew you'd come.
Michael: I would do anything --
Ian: Careful, Lucy.
Michael: I would give anything --
Ian: Make sure it's Michael.
Michael: Even my life.
Ian: Now, Lucy. Now.
Gabriela: Caleb, don't listen to them! They're trying to destroy you!
Michael: Caleb's gone.
Gabriela: It's a trick.
Lucy: She's in the way. I -- I can't get a good shot.
Ian: All right. Shoot as soon as I move her.
Michael: I'm not Caleb.
Gabriela: Caleb's here. You're Caleb.
Michael: You're wrong.
Gabriela: Let Caleb through.

Eve: Michael. Look at me, Michael. Stay with me. Don't listen to her. 
Michael.
Gabriela: Listen to me, Caleb!
Eve: Michael, please.
Ian: Shoot!
Gabriela: No!
Chris: What's going on? Where am I?
Karen: You don't remember?
Frank: Caleb got to you.
Chris: Caleb? You mean I'm a vampire?
Karen: Take it easy, Chris.
Chris: "Take it easy?" Get me out of these things. What --

Frank: Ramsey, don't give me an excuse to drive a wooden stake through what 
passes for your heart.
Chris: You know something? You'll be first on my list, Scanlon.

Karen: Hey, hey, hey. Chris, if you're looking forward to biting someone, I 
have some bad news for you.
Chris: What?
Karen: All your vitals are perfect. Well, close to normal, anyway.

Chris: What do you mean? I'm not showing one symptom of, you know, vampire 
behavior?

Frank: You almost look disappointed. Maybe there's just no difference between 
your normal readings and any ordinary, everyday bloodsucker.
Lucy: God, Ian! Are you ok?
Eve: Ian?
Ian: I'm fine. Stay there.
Michael: Eve, help me.
Gabriela: Listen to me, Caleb!
Eve: No, Michael. Michael, listen to me.
Gabriela: Don't let them trick you.
Jamal: Gabby, no.
Gabriela: No! No!
Eve: Don't abandon me, Michael.
Alison: I thought this might come in handy.
Eve: Don't let go.
Michael: I won't, Eve.
Eve: Oh!
Caleb: Checkmate, Mommy.
Eve: No, Michael.
Caleb: No use. Michael's gone.
Ian: You got to get another shot.

Lucy: I will, I will. I just got to stop this bleeding. Alison, do you have 
--
Caleb: He's gone, and it's for good. It's my body now, my future. Mine.
Eve: Michael.
Caleb: My life to have with my bride and my baby, my Olivia.
Kevin: She's my daughter, and her name is Livvie --
Caleb: You're a foolish man.
Kevin: Not Olivia.
Livvie: No, Dad. I'm the one he wants.
Caleb: Why, Olivia? Why couldn't you love me?
Livvie: I already told you I'd go with you.
Caleb: But you'd fight me.
Livvie: No, I won't.
Jack: Livvie, stop.
Livvie: Look, I'll stop fighting, but you have to let everyone else go.
Kevin: Livvie -- Livvie, don't do this!
Livvie: Let them all go and I'll give myself to you, Caleb, please.
Caleb: As a sacrifice. I want your love --
Eve: Michael --
Caleb: To be unconditional. True love is unconditional!

Eve: Michael, Michael, I believe in your heart. I know you believe in it, 
too.
Caleb: Olivia, please --

Eve: Michael, you know what you have to do. You know what's right. You have 
to destroy Caleb.
Caleb: No!

Eve: No! Michael -- Michael -- feel it, Michael. All of that love is for you. 
Please, save my happiness. Save me. Don't abandon me, Michael --
Caleb's Voice: What's it like to be a priest in love with a married woman?
Michael's Voice: You're hurting innocent people.
Livvie's Voice: With all my heart, I'm yours.
Caleb's Voice: What'd you do, promise Eve you'd take care of me for her?
Eve's Voice: You're the only one who can stop him.
Livvie's Voice: I know who you are --

Michael's Voice: I will do whatever it takes to keep Eve safe, even if it 
means destroying you.
Livvie's Voice: I died for you.
Eve's Voice: Stop him before it's too late.
Michael: Eve.
Eve: Michael.
Michael: Eve.
Ian: That's Michael. You got to get another shot.
Lucy: I know. I'm ready.
Michael: Help me. Dear God, help me.
Eve: Ian -- the stake!
Michael: Please finish it. Give me peace. End it. End it.
Eve: Ian?
Ian: It's ok. We're ok.
Eve: Oh, Michael.
Ian: We're ok.
Jack: Livvie.
Alison: Oh.
Lucy: Oh, my God.
Kevin: Are you ok?
Lucy: Yeah, yeah.
Ian: You sure?
Lucy: Yeah, Doc.
Eve: Poor Michael.
Livvie: It's finally over.
Kevin: Is everybody ok?
Ian: Yeah.
Jack: Yeah.
Lucy: Oh. I saw what I saw, but I don't believe what I just saw.
Kevin: Come here.
Jamal: Hey -- it's ok, baby. It's all over.
Eve: Oh, my gosh, your arm.
Ian: I'm fine. You ok?
Eve: Yeah. I did what I had to do. I just wish --

Ian: What, you could've saved Michael? I think you did. You saved all of us. 
Come on. Let's get you home.

Eve: No. First, I want to look at that arm. No arguments. And then I have

Ian: Where is that?
Eve: To pray for a good man and a lost soul who never had a chance.
Ian: Come on.
Karen: Eve --
Eve: It's all right now, Karen.
Karen: Oh, Ian, you're bleeding.
Ian: Ah, it's fine.
Eve: I'm going to fix that.
Karen: Caleb?
Ian: He's gone. Nothing left of him.
Karen: And everybody else?
Ian: Go see for yourself, all right?
Karen: Gabby.
Eve: Come on, Braveheart.
Lucy: Some vampire slayer I am, huh?

Kevin: Hey -- you got us out of that fire, you got us up here to the roof, 
and you were ready to take on as evil a force as any human being ever has. As 
far as I'm concerned, you are one beautiful, original -- the most original 
vampire slayer of all time.
Lucy: Oh, boy. I love you. I love you.
Kevin: I love you.
Livvie: Jack, it's really you. You're real and -- and we're safe.
Jack: Well, it's me, anyway.
Jamal: And I'll be damned if we're not the safest that we've been --
Alison: Jamal -- don't with the whole "damned" thing already. I'm serious.
Jamal: Ok. I got you, baby. I got you.
Alison: So, do you guys feel any better?
Livvie: Yeah. Actually, I -- I think I do.

Jamal: I guess the guy at the vampire shop was right -- big bat dies, 
everybody else turns back to normal.

Jack: Yeah, normal. I don't know what I would've done without you guys. Every 
time I lost my way, you guys were always there for me.
Jamal: That's what friends are all about. Right, Spunky?
Alison: Right.
Gabriela: Karen, I'm fine. Really. I'm fine.
Jamal: And then there was family.

Alison: Yeah. Jamal, you go ahead, ok, because I'm just going to go call 
Nana. I kind of just want to hear her voice, you know?
Jamal: Ok.
Alison: And then I'm going to stop by the chapel to say thank you.
Jamal: See you guys over there?

Livvie: Actually, I -- I'm going to catch up with my dad first, but we'll 
meet you guys there, right?
Jack: Yeah.
Alison: Ok.
Jamal: In the chapel?

Karen: Ok. In the ER, Gabby, in half an hour for a full check. Hold her to 
that, would you, Jamal?
Jamal: Got it.
Karen: Thanks.
Jamal: So, you ok?

Gabriela: I don't know. It's kind of like waking up from a nightmare. I don't 
know if that's good or bad.
Jamal: It's good. Good. Trust me.
Gabriela: I know you tried really hard to get through.
Jamal: Hey, hey, hey, hey -- we're family.
Livvie: Dad, Lucy -- I'm really sorry for putting you through all this.
Kevin: We're all in one piece. That's the only thing that counts.
Livvie: Yeah, well, I wouldn't be if it weren't for Jack.
Kevin: Jack, I -- I -- I don't know what to say.
Jack: Yeah. Makes two of us.

Kevin: Well, you didn't give up. And I can only imagine how hard you had to 
fight not to become what Caleb wanted you to be.

Jack: Yeah, well, I would say there was definitely something worth fighting 
for.

Kevin: For a long time, you were the only thing standing between my daughter 
and hell. I don't even know how to thank you for that.

Lucy: Hey, you know what? I -- I have a pretty good idea. For starters, we 
could leave these two alone just to be together for a little while, and why 
don't we go someplace and just try and thank the universe for getting us through 
this, huh?
Kevin: You're a wise woman, Ms. Kovich.
Lucy: Oh, can't I just be, like, plain old Lucy Coe tonight?
Kevin:  Plain?  Old? I don't think so.
Lucy: Do you think my crossbow is sexy?
Kevin: Give me that.
Livvie: I can't believe it's over.
Jack: Well, believe it. I'm even starting to feel like my old self again.
Livvie: I love you.

Jack: I love you, too. All our dreams are possible, Livvie. Now we can start 
building our life together, start planning it out. A real future. Our Future.
Livvie: Our future.

Frank: Well, thank God. That's all I can say. Yeah. I'll meet you down there. 
I'm on my way.
Chris: Down where?
Frank: Don't worry, Chris. You're not invited.
Chris: Well, what did she say?

Frank: Caleb's dead, Chris. That's why you're not showing any of the 
symptoms.
Chris:  Dead? You mean I'm not going to get to become a vampire?

Frank: Sorry, but I'll be happy to use that wooden stake on you anyway. Just 
let me know, all right?
Chris: Oh.
Ian: Sure you're ok?
Eve: My back aches a little bit.
Ian: Well, I'm the expert. Turn around. Come on.
Eve: Michael.
Ian: Hey. Come on.
Eve: I'm the only one who really knew him, Ian. He had such a good heart.
Ian: Well, you always bring out the best in people.
Eve: And his soul was good -- pure and loving and sweet.

Ian: You looked evil in the face and saw the goodness in it. Look at me. 
That's the bravest thing I've ever seen.
Eve: I had to do it, Ian. I had to.
Ian: I know. I know. So in the end it was beauty killed the beast.

Eve: Do you know how lucky we are to have each other, to love each other and 
bring our baby into the world with no fear? We have nothing to be afraid of 
anymore.
Ian: I know how lucky I am every time I look at you.

Father Vicente: Vamos, m'hijo. Doctors, welcome. Our faith in faith was 
well placed, I hear.
Ian: That it was, Father.
Father Vicente: For today and for always.
Gabriela: Emilio, I'm so sorry.
Emilio: No more tears, hermanita.

Lucy: You know what? Maybe, you know, what I am and everything -- I don't 
belong here.
Father Vicente: Of course you do. Welcome.

Lucy: Well, thanks, but you don't quite know what I did. I sort of might be 
responsible for someone dying.

Father Vicente: And I believe a force far greater than you may have been 
responsible.
Lucy: Thank you.
Ian: Will you say a prayer, Father?

Father Vicente: My children, with all our hearts, we pray the tortured soul 
of Caleb Morley may find peace. And now let us bow our heads in silent 
recognition of the sacrifice and choices made. Lord, give us the grace to hold 
you when all is weariness and fear and sin abounds within and without. Give us 
grace that we may know that in the darkness pressing round, it is the mist of 
sin that hides your face, that you are there and you do know we love you still. 
Our dependence and endurance in your will is still our gift of love.

Jack: So, thinking about heading over to the chapel, hooking up with 
everybody. I kind of feel like saying thanks to whoever was looking out for us.

Livvie: Yeah, that sounds great. But, you know, I think I just need, like, a 
couple of minutes just to kind of catch my breath, you know?
Jack: Why don't we go to some kind of lounge or --
Livvie: Hey -- hey, Jack -- here's fine. I mean, Caleb's dead, right?
Jack: Right, Caleb's gone.
Livvie: Look, I could just meet you down there.

Jack: No. No, no, no, no. You're right. Caleb's dead. Caleb's gone. I'll wait 
right here.
Livvie: Ok.

Father Vicente: Rest eternal grant unto him, O Lord, and let light perpetual 
shine upon him, presenting him before the face of the most highest. And now let 
us all say amen.
All: Amen.
Jamal: Amen, Spunky.
Alison: Amen.
Frank: Do you know how much I love you?
Karen: Remind me.
Kevin: Do you feel any better?

Lucy: Not yet. There is something I need to go say. Will you kind of stick 
around for backup?
Kevin: Right behind you.
Lucy: I could always count on you.
Kevin: Oh, count away.
Lucy: Ok. Um -- Ian --
Ian: Lucy.
Lucy: Uh -- I shot you. You know, I am -- I am so sorry. Are you ok?

Ian: I'm fine, and what are you sorry for? You did what I asked you to do, 
what you were supposed to do. And truth be told, I got in the way.
Lucy: Yeah, you did.
Ian: Yeah --
Lucy: Well, but, thank you. Eve, I'm so sorry about --
[Eve gasps]
Kevin: Eve?
Eve: Ow.
Ian: Lambert, what?
Eve: Oh, my God, Ian --
Ian: What? What is it? What?
Eve: The baby -- it's coming.

Caleb's Voice: Olivia -- our souls are bound together, my love. It will never

Livvie: Caleb?
Caleb's Voice: Never.
